ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, the material applies to students from different fields.

Great course that will prepare you in a very serious way for the work that we are all supposed to be doing as literary scholars in a rapidly changing disciplinary context. Essential stuff at least for all grad students in English. So, yes, definitely recommended

I would recommend this course highly but with the caveat that a number of readings were at times quite abstruse. However, I found the seminar to be highly stimulating and with a great deal of interdisciplinary relevance.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: We discussed challenges facing academic research today, which were a welcome opportunity to discuss developments within the profession. The theoretical framework for studying literature as cultural discourse will prove a useful tool for my research.
Feel like I have a sense of where the field of English literary criticism is at this moment and why. All three of my papers this semester were at least in part inspired by material from this course
